definition: to shake/to vibrate/to jolt/to quake/excited/shocked/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing thunder/☳
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: When shocked, she opens her mouth as she knits her brows.
sentences.chinese: 當她震驚的時候，她會張開嘴巴，同時皺起眉頭。

sentences.english: Shocking footage from China has captured the moment the outer wall of a high-rise building 'peels' off and crashes to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 令人震驚的視頻顯示中國高層建築的外層剝落的情景。

sentences.english: Japanese community in shock, has begun relief efforts.
sentences.chinese: 日本社會各界在震驚之餘，已開始全力抗震救災。
寶萊塢的造夢者們被震驚了。

sentences.english: They were appalled by the damage from the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他們對火災所造成的損失感到震驚。

sentences.english: "When it happened to me, it was a shock, " the oncologist tells Terry Gross.
sentences.chinese: 此事驟然發生在我身上，這是一個震驚。

sentences.english: I was surprised at the news about his death.
sentences.chinese: 他去世的消息令我感到震驚。

sentences.english: Would you be shocked if I changed into something more comfortable?
sentences.chinese: 假如我換一身更舒服的衣服你會覺得震驚嗎？

sentences.english: The results have astounded the world.
The Mossad has a record of taking startling risks.
sentences.chinese: 摩薩德曾有擔負令人震驚的風險作案的先例。

sentences.english: That, says the Lancet, was a shocking failure.
sentences.chinese: 《柳葉刀》認爲，這是一個令人震驚的失敗。

sentences.english: Last year a case of shocking murder happened in the Politics and Law University of China.
sentences.chinese: 去年中國政法大學發生一起震驚的兇殺案。

sentences.english: If you saw a picture of Porto Velho then, you would be shocked.
sentences.chinese: 如果你見過一張波多維柳的照片，你肯定會震驚。

sentences.english: To make it to this list, a lens has to astound.
sentences.chinese: 爲了讓這份名單，一個鏡頭要震驚。

sentences.english: Jill was so shocked by the bad news that she couldn't say a single word.
sentences.chinese: 傑爾聽到這個壞消息震驚得一個字都說不出來。

definition: to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
